newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bonds ended the first day of a new month in minus territory as the franc tumbled versus the dollar and mark to its lowest levels in nearly two years.

December Swiss Confederate "Conf" futures were able to briefly retest the contract high of 115.80 set on October 9 as the session began. But the brush with old peaks was short-lived as the franc weakened. U.S. and German debt prices also fell.

Shorter maturities began under pressure and continued to drop. LIFFE's March three-month EuroSwiss contract ended near its lows for the day. But the contract remained inside an ever-narrowing range seen since late October.
Dec Conf futures CONFZ6 down 20 at 115.20.
Dec Comi medium-term bond COMIZ6 off three at 110.07
Mar Euro Swiss francs FESM7 down eight at 97.81.
